moves.1. e4: an interesting game with fred. Almost gave me the first place in the round 1...
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6: Najdorf again... is there a mode, or what?
moves.6. Be2: i may be wrong but this seems to me a little bit shy
moves.6... e6: with Najdorf, I try to find a way to protect my king first.
moves.8... h6 9. Bh4 Qb6 10. Rb1 O-O: one of the very rare games with Najdorf where I felt comfortable to rook
moves.11. Kh1: obviously, he didn't like the diagonal I took with my queen
moves.11... g5: and more: i castled, and then saw an opening on our king side.
moves.12. Bg3 e5: I am forcing him, so I recuperate time to develop (i am a little bit late)
moves.13. Nf3: the dark bishop and the (now f3) knight have moved a lot...
moves.13... Nc6 14. Na4 Qb4: so has my queen... And she will dance.
moves.15. c3: I was planning Nc3, Nxe4, Nxe4, Qxe4...
moves.15... Qxe4: but we saved time :-) one (fragile) pawn ahead.
moves.19. Nxc8 Rbxc8 20. Be2 Qg6: and again... there are many threats here, but white castle is not as opened as it looks like with moves like g4.
moves.21. Nh2 Rfe8 22. Ng4 Rcd8: planning to ocupate the center, now.
moves.23... Qxf6 24. Qd5 Qe6: and this ends the queen's dance, reforcing the center. May seem silly, but this strong center will save the day
moves.25. Qxe6 fxe6: here we are: the two white bishops are blocked by a strong center.
moves.29. fxe4 Bxc3: and now, I have a passed pawn...
moves.30. Bh5: interesting, i did not expect that. But i think fred was trying to push me to draw.
moves.30... Ref8 31. Bc5 Rf4 32. exd5 Rxd5: here is my passed pawn. But the next moves will be very careful.
moves.33. Be3 Rff5: much much better than exchange because of potential Bf7 arriving.
moves.34. Bf3 Rd3 35. Bb6: of course not the tempting Be4, losing on Rxf1+
moves.38... Rd7 39. Bg4: White does not know what to do... or does he?
moves.40... Bd4+ 41. Bxd4 Nxd4 42. Bd5:
this definitely loses, but anyanyway the exchanges would have come and let me win this very interesting game.
Here, the continuation is Ne2+ and white loses a rook. But on Bh5, which unauthorizes Ne2, there are good continuations following the exchange. I think
